title: ALLEGATI EMAIL
content:
Ciao a tutti. Da quando ho installato l'ultimo aggiornamento 115.3.2, succede una cosa alquanto strana che prima chiaramente non succedeva. Strana e scomoda.

Aprendo in una nuova scheda un allegato, lo stesso lo vedo tranquillamente.

Chiudendo e riaprendo Thunderbird, la scheda rimane ma l'allegato scompare riportando in schermata tale messaggio:

Indirizzo non interpretabile Uno dei seguenti protocolli (imap) non è registrato oppure non è consentito in questo contesto. È necessario installare del software aggiuntivo per aprire questo indirizzo.

Quando clicco "Riprova" scompare anche questo messaggio e sono costretto a ricercare l'allegato nella posta e riaprilo.

Qualcuno sa come risolvere questo problema davvero fastidioso?

Grazie!
creator: guidodep91

title: Thunderbird not displaying email folders or calendar events after 115.3.2 (64-bit) update
content:
After Thunderbird updated to 115.3.2 (64-bit), both calendar events and email folders disappeared. The issues occurred when I restarted Thunderbird. I had put my system to sleep at night and not restarted for a few days. When the problem occurred I 

* Exited and restarted Thunderbird * Restarted my system * Researched related problems in Mozilla and other web sites using browser search. * Reviewed the latest recommended settings  ** I made Thunderbird changes as recommended by Google * Again restarted Thunderbird * Insured that I'm working Online * Verified my Account Settings

When restarting Thunderbird, I see what appear to be folder update messages at the bottom of the screen.

System info (Latest service packs are installed): Processor AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 16-Core Processor 3.40 GHz Installed RAM 32.0 GB System type 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor

Edition Windows 10 Pro Version 22H2 Installed on ‎11/‎29/‎2020 OS build 19045.3448 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.19044.1000.0

title: Why can't I sign in after update115
content: Sorry for posting this here but no response in TB forum. After I installed the latest up grade TB 115 I have lost all the old emails in my inbox, sent, and trash as well as the ability to use TB as I can't sign in. I get the following prompt when trying to use my account. "Sending of password for user ****@att.net did not succeed. Mail server inbound.att.net responded: [SYS/TEMP] Server error - Please try again later", and then a prompt to "Enter your password" which does not work, although the pass word shows up in"passwords". The TB account works fine in the Yahoo web account, but I don't keep anything there on a daily basis. The web TB account lets me send and receive mail normally. I haven't changed my configuration ,password or uninstalled TB. My G mail works normally. My android cell also won't let me sign in and asks for credentials per password which is unrecognized.
creator: Bob9754

title: Moving profile to new PC - no messages
content:
Hi,

I have been having difficulties moving Thunderbird profiles to new PC's. It has happened to me twice now where I have moved my profile and Thunderbird can't see my messages on the new PC. I have followed the instructions here:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer# and: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles

I copied the profile from the old PC to an ext drive, and then moved it to the new PC in the proper location: C:\Users\mike\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird

On the new PC, I go into the Profile chooser window using "thunderbird -p" and I don't see the new profile. I have also tried copying my old profile over top of an existing profile on the new PC as described in the above articles, and when I start Thunderbird, I still don't see my messages.

I must be missing something, as the process seems pretty straightforward. Has anyone else experience this?

I am on Supernova 115.3.2 on Windows 11.

Thanks.
creator: msfox1

content:

Any way to fix this?

title: Pasting hyperlinks in an outgoing email message
content: For certain reasons I am using an older version of Thunderbird, 68.12.0 (64-bit) in WIndows 10. I find that when I paste a hyperlink into the message, the Send button is grayed out. This is really annoying. Is there some setting in the config that could be changed to allow sending messages with links?
creator: gersen77

title: Thunderbird stopped downloading POP3 AT&T/Yahoo emails
content:
2 weeks ago (9/27), Thunderbird 102.15.1 stopped downloading emails from AT&T/Yahoo POP3 account.

On 9/29, I upgraded to 115.3.1, but still getting no downloads from that account, though on the Yahoo web interface, I can see emails are coming in.

POP server: inbound.att.net, Port 995 (default) TB 115.3.1 on Windows 10 PC

AT&T is my ISP, and my email address has their swbell.net domain, hosted by Yahoo.

Other swbell.net POP accounts with same configuration on this installation of TB are still downloading emails, as are IMAP accts. (Though IMAP accts are not AT&T/Yahoo ones.)

I emptied Trash and compacted the inbox to no avail. Also deleted Inbox.msf, and let Thunderbird rebuild it, again to no avail.

Clicking on the “Get Messages” icon results in the bottom status bar saying “Checking Inbox for new messages…”, but nothing happens, and after a few minutes, that line disappears.

Does anyone have other suggestions? Thanks in advance, Ed
creator: evigil

title: Thunderbird email
content: I donated before I downloaded Thunderbird e-mail. Why does the "donate" screen pop up again when I open the website?
creator: inge1950

title: "403 Forbidden" error when trying to connect to university Gmail account with Thunderbird 115
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for all my email accounts and calendars, all of which are Google accounts. A week ago, a message in Thunderbird from my university Gmail account asked me to sign in again. This was a separate, smaller Google window with my email address already there, and a button "Next", presumably to enter my password or go to a university sign-in page. But when I click next, it just goes to a white page with "403 Forbidden" written. The URL at the top that it is apparently trying to go to is a university security/authentication thing.

Ever since then, this is the only result I get when trying to connect to this Gmail account. I have deleted the account from Thunderbird and tried re-connecting it in many ways, entering the server settings manually (with OAuth2), etc., and this same thing always happens. I have also tried deleting the cookies from this account, and clearing my entire Firefox cache and cookies. Please let me know what other details I can give.

For the record, I am using Ubuntu 22.04, but I recently tried this on a Mac, and all the exact same things happened with Thunderbird. However, using web-based Gmail works fine (Ubuntu and Firefox), and I can also connect to this email account with the Mac Mail client normally.

Thank you
creator: karl.lerud

title: Thunderbird 115 - Problems with Message List Display
content:
After upgrading from 102 to 115 I noticed 3 problems with the way Message Lists in e-mail folders are being displayed.

I set my Inbox message list display options to: Table View, Sort By: Received, Ascending, Grouped by Sort. This gives me groups of Older, Last 14 Days, Last 7 Days, Yesterday and Today with arrows to collapse or expand the groups. I keep the first 4 groups collapsed and only group Today expanded.

Problem 1: When I navigate to a different folder then back to Inbox, all the groups are now expanded and must be re-collapsed. In 102 the Message List Display would remember the collapsed/expanded state of each group while 105 the state for all groups is changed to expanded.

Problem 2: In 102, when a group is collapsed the Message List Line shows for the group shows only the collapse/expand arrow, the group name and the number of messages in the group. Example: " > Last 14 Days (2) "

In 115, when a collapse is executed, the group name line below is not properly erased so that From, Received, and Size fields show the From, Received and Size from the message that previously was on that specific screen line which is the top message in the newly collapsed group. Example: " > Older (19) " Example: " AT&T > Last 14 Days (2) 9/3/2022, 4:29 PM 1.6 MB " Example: " LinkedIn V Today (6/6) 8/20/2023, 1:18 PM 42.5 KB " (Other fields may behave similarly but I have not seen it because those fields were blank anyway)

Problem 3: This occurs in 115, and in 102 which I have previously reported but did not get fixed in 115. When the popup requesting file cleanup pops up and continue is clicked, when it finishes the Message list display options Sort by > Grouped By Sort becomes unchecked and my message list is no longer grouped by sort. See: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1371381

(PS I love the new access to the Message list display options so I don't have to search through multiple levels of view options to find and re-check Grouped by sort. However WHY did you use that Icon instead of the standard 3 line hamburger Icon??? The Icon you used looks like the Windows 10 Task View Icon)

Thunderbird 115.3.1 (64 bit), Windows 10 Home, 22H2
creator: gtalbott202

title: ISP passwords, as distinct from "retail" ones
content:
I used to understand this stuff, but have now aged out (at 91) and am totally lost. In the old days, starting with the 3-bar menu symbol, there was a path to reach the place where Thunderbird stored the passwords needed to get access to one's ISP accounts. If that still exists, I can't now find it.

I have a new Dell laptop that I am trying to activate. Comcast does not accept the PWs (that I have written down), so I want to find them on this older machine where they still work. Following TB's instructions, the expected "Saved Passwords" box does not appear; instead we get "Saved Logins". "Logins" is apparently a synonym for what I might call "retail" passwords, used to access bank, vendor, &c accounts, but these are distinct from network-access accounts. (In general, I think TB fails to distinguish adequately between the two password categories, but that's another question.)

So the question is: how do I get access to the ISP passwords stored on this old, working, machine, so I can use them on the new one?

I am using 115.3.2 on win11.
creator: wagtail1

title: positioning in incoming message stream
content:
Using 115.3.2 on win11, when switching between my 3 active (Comcast) email accounts, I want the display of received messages to show the latest, with the newest at the bottom. As I remember, this was the way it worked in earlier times, but now the display shows some arbitrary (to me) receipt times. Sometimes these are now as far back as 3 months, and many hundreds of messages ago.

Is there a setting somewhere that says: "show latest messages at the end of the displayed list"?

This problem can be "fixed" with a few keystrokes each time, but it is annoying to have to incessantly do that.
creator: wagtail1

title: Adding Contact to Several Address Books
content:
Maybe I just don't understand how Thunderbird Address Books work, But I have several set up as lists to different committees within an organization. Some of the contacts within this organization participate on several of the committees. With that said then I have a contact - If they are not part of the organization I have them in my Personal Address Book. If they are also part of the Organization, I need to add them to that Address Book too. And, if they are part of other committees I need to add them to those Address Books too.

How is what I need to do performed within Thunderbird?

I'm using version 115.3.2
creator: JCtheWizard
